Geometric Progression

A sequence is said to be a \(\mathbf{geometric}\) \(\mathbf{progression}\) or \(\mathbf{G.P.}\), if the ratio of any term to its preceding term is same throughout.
  • \(\mathbf{Common}\) \(\mathbf{Ratio}\): The ratio of any term to its preceding term in a G.P is known as common ratio. Common ratio is constant throughout the G.P. .
  • The necessary information to form a G.P. are its first term \((a)\) and its common ratio \((r)\) .
  • \(\mathbf{General}\) \(\mathbf{Form}\): General form of a G.P. is $$a,ar,ar^2,ar^3,\ldots $$
  • \(\mathbf{General}\) \(\mathbf{Term}\) or \(\mathbf{n^{th}}\) \(\mathbf{term}\): General term / \(n^{th}\) term of a G.P. is $$a_n=ar^{n-1}$$ Where, \(a\) is the first term and \(r\) is the common ratio
  • \(\mathbf{Sum}\) \(\mathbf{of}\) \(\mathbf{n}\) \(\mathbf{terms}\): Sum of first \(n\) terms of a G.P. is $$S_n=\frac{a(r^n-1)}{r-1} or \frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r}$$
  • \(\mathbf{Geometric}\) \(\mathbf{Mean(G.M.)}\): The geometric mean (G.M.) of any two positive numbers a and b is given by $$G.M.=\sqrt{ab}$$
  • To form a G.P. by inserting \(m\) numbers between a and b the common ratio(r) should be $$r=\left(\frac ba\right)^{\frac{1}{m+1}}$$
